1.verse: Prologue: Job’s Prosperity, Woes, and Resignation -Chapter 1 -A Good and Righteous Man. -Job, a good and righteous man, lived in the land of Uz. He feared God and shunned evil.

2.verse: He was the father of seven sons and three daughters,

3.verse: and he possessed seven thousand sheep, three thousand camels, five hundred yoke of oxen, and five hundred donkeys, in addition to a large number of servants. Thus, he was the greatest man throughout the entire East.

4.verse: Job’s sons had the custom of taking turns hosting banquets in one another’s house, and they would invite their three sisters to eat and drink with them.

5.verse: And when each banquet had been completed, Job would send for his children and sanctify them, rising early in the morning and sacrificing burnt offerings for each of them. For Job said, “It could perhaps have happened that my sons have sinned and blasphemed against God in their hearts.” This was his regular custom.

6.verse: “Why Should Job Not Be a God-Fearing Man?” -One day the sons of God assembled to present themselves before the Lord, and Satan was with them.

7.verse: The Lord said to Satan, “Where have you come from?” Satan answered the Lord and said, “I have been roaming the earth and going back and forth in it.”

8.verse: The Lord asked him, “Have you paid any notice to my servant Job? You will not find anyone like him on the entire earth. He is a good and righteous man who fears God and shuns evil.”

9.verse: Satan said in reply, “Why should Job not be a God-fearing man?

10.verse: You have safeguarded him and his family and all his possessions with your protection. You have blessed every one of his undertakings, and his flocks have continued to increase throughout the land.

11.verse: But if you stretch out your hand and strike all that he has, he will surely curse you to your face.”

12.verse: The Lord then said, “Very well. All that he has is in your power. However, you may not lay a hand upon him.” So Satan went forth from the presence of the Lord.

13.verse: Messengers of Woe. -One day when Job’s sons and daughters were feasting and drinking wine in their eldest brother’s house,

14.verse: a messenger came to Job and said, “While your oxen were plowing and the donkeys were grazing beside them,

15.verse: the Sabeans swooped down on them and carried them off, after first putting the herdsmen to the sword. I alone have escaped to tell you.”

16.verse: While he was speaking, another messenger arrived and said, “The fire of God flashed from heaven, striking the sheep and their shepherds and consuming them. I alone have escaped to tell you.”

17.verse: While he was still speaking, another messenger ran up and said, “Three bands of Chaldeans made a raid on the camels and carried them off and slaughtered those who were tending them. I alone have escaped to tell you.”

18.verse: While he was still speaking, yet another messenger came forth and said, “Your sons and daughters were feasting and drinking wine in their eldest brother’s house.

19.verse: Then suddenly a powerful wind swept across the desert. It struck the four corners of the house, which collapsed upon the young people, and they are all dead. I alone have escaped to tell you.”Blessed Be the Name of the Lord. -

20.verse: Then Job arose, tore his cloak, and shaved his head. He threw himself prostrate on the ground

21.verse: and said:“Naked I emerged from my mother’s womb,and naked I will return.The Lord gave, and the Lord has taken away;blessed be the name of the Lord.”

22.verse: In all this, Job did not sin, nor did he revile God.

1.verse: Chapter 2 -Have You Paid Any Notice to My Servant Job? -On another occasion the sons of God came forward to present themselves before the Lord, and Satan accompanied them.

2.verse: The Lord said to Satan, “Where have you come from?” Satan answered the Lord and said, “I have been roaming the earth and going back and forth in it.”

3.verse: The Lord said to Satan, “Have you paid any notice to my servant Job? You will not find anyone like him on the entire earth. He is a good and righteous man who fears God and shuns evil. He still maintains his integrity, even though you incited me to ruin him without the slightest justification.”

4.verse: Satan answered the Lord, “Skin for skin! A man will surrender everything he has to save his own life.

5.verse: But now if you stretch forth your hand and touch his bone and his flesh, he will curse you to your face.”

6.verse: The Lord said to Satan, “He is in your power, but you must spare his life.”

7.verse: Job Did Not Utter a Single Sinful Word. -Therefore, when Satan left the Lord’s presence, he afflicted Job with malignant sores from the soles of his feet to the top of his head.

8.verse: Job took a potsherd to scrape himself as he sat among the ashes.

9.verse: Then his wife said to him, “When will you give up persisting in your integrity? Curse God and die!”

10.verse: He replied, “You are talking like a foolish woman. If we accept good things from God, should we not be willing to accept sorrows as well?” In all this, Job did not utter a single sinful word.

11.verse: The Three Friends. -When three of Job’s friends heard of all the misfortunes that he had endured, each of them set out from his own home—Eliphaz the Temanite, Bildad the Shuhite, and Zophar the Naamathite. After they gathered together, they went forth to console and comfort him.

12.verse: However, when they first saw Job from a distance, they could hardly recognize him, and they wept aloud, tore their cloaks, and threw dust into the air over their heads.

13.verse: Then they sat there with him upon the ground for seven days and seven nights. None of them spoke a word to him, for they could clearly see how greatly he was suffering.

1.verse: First Cycle of Speeches -Job Curses the Day He Was Born -Chapter 3 -Perish the Day on Which I Was Born. -After this, Job opened his mouth and cursed the day of his birth.

2.verse: He said:

3.verse: “Perish the day on which I was bornand the night it was said, ‘A boy is born.’

4.verse: May that day turn to darkness;may God not take note of it from above,and may light not shine upon it.

5.verse: May gloom and heavy darkness claim it;let clouds spread over itand blackness eclipse its light.

6.verse: May thick darkness overpower it;let it not be numbered among the days of the yearor reckoned in the cycle of the months.

7.verse: “May that night be barren;let no cry of joy be heard during it.

8.verse: Let those curse it who curse the seaand are prepared to rouse Leviathan.

9.verse: May the stars of its twilight be darkened;let it wait in vain for daylightand never behold the first rays of dawn,

10.verse: because it refused to shut the doorsof the womb of my mother who bore meand shield my eyes from sorrow.

11.verse: Why Go On Living? -“Why did I not die at birth,perishing as I came forth from the womb?

12.verse: Why were there knees to receive meor breasts for me to feed on?

13.verse: “For now I would be lying in tranquility,asleep and resting peacefully

14.verse: with kings and counselors of the earthwho built palaces for themselves that now lie in ruins,

15.verse: or with princes who possessed gold in abundanceand filled their homes with silver.

16.verse: Or why was I not laid in a grave like a stillborn child,like an infant that had never seen the light?

17.verse: “In death the wicked are free from worldly troublesand the weary find rest.

18.verse: There the captives enjoy the solace of peacewithout having to cringe at the voice of their masters.

19.verse: The small and the great are there as equals,and servants are free from their masters.

20.verse: What Good Is Life? -“Why is light given to those in miseryand life to those whose hearts are bitter,

21.verse: who long for death that never comesand seek for it more than for hidden treasure,

22.verse: who would rejoice to see the graveand exult on reaching the tomb,

23.verse: who are unable to find their wayand whom God has hemmed in on every side?

24.verse: “Sighs are for me my only food,and my groans pour forth like water.

25.verse: Everything that I fear has afflicted me,and whatever I dread befalls me.

26.verse: I am unable to find peace of mind or tranquility;troubles assail me, and I find no rest.”

1.verse: Eliphaz’s First Speech -Chapter 4 -Can You Recall Even One Innocent Person Who Perished? -Then Eliphaz the Temanite responded:

2.verse: “If one of us attempts to reason with you, will you be offended?Yet who can refrain from speaking?

3.verse: Recall how you instructed many othersand strengthened their feeble hands.

4.verse: Your words have supported those who were staggering,and you have made firm their faltering knees.

5.verse: “But now that adversity has befallen you, you have grown impatient;you are dismayed because it has troubled you.

6.verse: Does not your piety give you confidenceand the integrity of your life offer you hope?

7.verse: Can you recall even one innocent person who perished?Where have the upright ever been destroyed?

8.verse: “My experience has been that those who plow iniquity and sow troublereap no other harvest.

9.verse: At the breath of God they are destroyed;at the blast of his anger they perish.

10.verse: Even though they are as fierce as lions,their fangs will be broken off.

11.verse: The lion perishes for lack of prey,and the whelps of the lioness are abandoned.

12.verse: Can a Human Being Appear Upright in the Presence of God? -“A word was quietly brought to me;a whisper of it reached my ears.

13.verse: It was made known to me in nighttime visionswhen sleep comes upon all men.

14.verse: I was seized with terror and tremblingthat caused all my bones to shake violently.

15.verse: A spirit brushed across my face,causing the hairs on my body to bristle.

16.verse: It then halted,but I could not discern its shape.An image was before my eyes,and then I heard a voice whisper:

17.verse: “ ‘Can a human being appear upright in the presence of God?Can a mortal seem pure before its Maker?

18.verse: God places no trust in his servants,and he finds fault even with his angels.

19.verse: How much more will this be true of those who dwell in houses of clay,whose foundation is in the dustand who can be crushed as easily as a moth.

20.verse: From morning to evening they are cut down;they perish forever, with hardly a thought from anyone.

21.verse: Their tent-pegs are plucked up,and they die devoid of wisdom.’

1.verse: Chapter 5 -Resentment Slays the Fool -“Call out now if you so wish.Is there anyone who will reply?To which of the holy ones will you turn?

2.verse: Resentment slays the fool,and envy brings death to the simpleton.

3.verse: I have seen a fool enjoy success for a time,but suddenly his house was cursed.

4.verse: “His children are cut off from safety,slaughtered at the gate without a defender.

5.verse: The hungry devour their harvest,even that growing amid the thorns,and the thirsty pant for their wealth.

6.verse: For misery does not grow out of the earth,nor does trouble spring from the soil.

7.verse: Rather, man breeds trouble for himself,as surely as sparks fly upward.

8.verse: I Would Appeal to God -“If I were you, I would appeal to Godand present my case before him.

9.verse: He performs deeds that are beyond understanding,and wonders that cannot be counted.

10.verse: He provides rain for the earthand sends down water upon the fields.

11.verse: He raises on high those who are lowly,and those who mourn he lifts to safety.

12.verse: “He thwarts the schemes of the craftyso that they do not achieve any success.

13.verse: He traps the cunning in their intriguesand throws their plans into disarray.

14.verse: They encounter darkness in the daytimeand grope their way at noon as if it were night.

15.verse: But he saves the destitute from the swordand rescues them from the hand of the mighty.

16.verse: Therefore, the poor once again have hope,and iniquity must shut its mouth.

17.verse: Blessed Is the Man Whom God Reproves -“Blessed is the man whom God reproves.Therefore, do not reject the discipline of the Almighty.

18.verse: For even though he wounds, he also binds up;he smites, but his hands also heal.

19.verse: He will deliver you from trouble six times,and on the seventh no evil will touch you.

20.verse: In time of famine he will rescue you from death,and in wartime from the thrust of the sword.

21.verse: “You will be shielded from the scourge of the tongue,and you will not fear calamity when it looms.

22.verse: You will laugh at destruction and famineand not be terrified by the beasts of the earth.

23.verse: For you will have a covenant with the stones of the fieldand live in peace with wild animals.

24.verse: You will know that your tent is secure,and your household will be intact when you inspect it.

25.verse: “You will know that your descendants will be numerous,and your offspring like the grass of the earth.

26.verse: You will go to the grave at a ripe old age,like sheaves gathered at the right time.

27.verse: All this we have researched, and it is true.Heed it, and apply it to yourself.”

1.verse: Job’s First Response -Chapter 6 -Impetuous Words. -Job then answered with these words:

2.verse: “If only my anguish could be weighedand my misfortune placed with it on the scales.

3.verse: They would then outweigh the sands of the sea—hence, my words have been impetuous.

4.verse: For the arrows of the Almighty have pierced me,and my spirit soaks in their poison;God’s terrors are aligned against me.

5.verse: “Does the wild donkey bray when it has grass?Does an ox bellow when it has fodder?

6.verse: Can tasteless food be eaten without salt?Is there any flavor in the whites of eggs?

7.verse: I refuse to even touch them;they are like uncleanness in my food.

8.verse: The Consolation of Death -“Oh, that I might receive my requestand God would grant me what I hope for:

9.verse: that it would please him to crush me,cutting me off and ceasing to restrain his hand.

10.verse: Such would be my consolation,and I would exult in my unrelenting pain,since I have never rebelled against the commands of the Holy One.

11.verse: “Do I have the strength to continue to wait?And what future awaits me should I decide to be patient?

12.verse: Is my strength the strength of stone?Is my flesh made of bronze?

13.verse: How can I summon up the energy to survive?All possible solutions to my plight are beyond my reach.

14.verse: My Brethren Have Betrayed Me -“One who despairs should have the support of his friendseven if he has forsaken the fear of the Almighty.

15.verse: But my brethren have proved to be as treacherous as a torrent,like watercourses that suddenly run dry;

16.verse: they turn dark with iceand swell with the thawing of the snow,

17.verse: but they dry up in the hot season,and in the heat vanish from their beds.

18.verse: “Caravans wander off from their course;they go into the wilderness and perish.

19.verse: The caravans of Tema search for water;the travelers from Sheba move forward in hope.

20.verse: But despite their confidence they are doomed to disappointment;they arrive there, only to be frustrated.

21.verse: In much the same way you have dealt with me;you are stunned at my plight and are terrified.

22.verse: Make Me Understand How I Have Been at Fault -“Did I ever ask you to give me anything,or to use your vast wealth to alleviate my travails,

23.verse: or to rescue me from the hands of an oppressor,or to ransom me from the power of ruthless men?

24.verse: “Instruct me, and I will be silent;make me understand how I have been at fault.

25.verse: I can readily accept logical explanations,but your arguments are without merit.

26.verse: Do you think that your words should be embracedwhereas mine are so fragile that they can be borne away by a light breeze?

27.verse: You would even cast lots for the fatherlessand sell your friend at a bargain price.

28.verse: “Therefore, now I beg you to look at me,for I will not lie to your face.

29.verse: Consider what I have said,and let no further injustice be inflicted upon me.

30.verse: Does evil issue forth from my lips?Would I not realize it if I spoke untruthfully?

1.verse: Chapter 7 -A Life of Exhausting Service -“Is not man’s life on earth an exhausting one,and are not his days like those of a hired laborer?

2.verse: Like a slave who sighs for the evening shadeand like a laborer who is bent upon his wages,

3.verse: so have I been forced to endure months of futility,and nights of grief have been inflicted on me.

4.verse: “When I lie in bed, I wonder,‘When will the daylight come so that I may rise?’But the night drags on,and I toss restlessly until the dawn.

5.verse: My body is infected with worms and scabs;my skin is cracked and festering.

6.verse: My Life Is But a Breath -“My days pass more swiftly than a weaver’s shuttle,and they come to an end without a glimmer of hope.

7.verse: “Remember that my life is but a breath of wind;my eyes will never again see happiness.

8.verse: The eye that now sees me will see me no more;I will vanish before your very eyes.

9.verse: As a cloud vanishes and is no more,so the one who descends to the netherworld will never come up again.

10.verse: He will never again return to his home,nor will he be remembered anymore.

11.verse: “Therefore, I will not restrain my mouth.I will speak out in my anguish of spirit,and I will complain in the bitterness of my soul.

12.verse: Am I a monster of the deep, or a sea serpent,that you place me under guard?

13.verse: When I say, ‘I will find comfort in my bed,and my couch will soothe my complaints,’

14.verse: you then frighten me with dreamsand terrify me with visions,

15.verse: so that I would prefer to be strangledand to endure death rather than my sufferings.

16.verse: My life is ebbing away; I cannot live forever.Leave me alone, for my days are but a breath.

17.verse: A Continual Testing -“What is man, that you make so much of himor pay him any mind?

18.verse: You examine him every morningand test him every moment of the day.

19.verse: “Will you never take your eyes from me,or let me alone long enough to swallow my saliva?

20.verse: If I have sinned, what harm have I done to you,O watcher of humanity?Why have you designated me to be your target?Why have I become a burden to you?

21.verse: Why do you not pardon my offensesand forgive my iniquity?For soon I will lie down in the dust;you will search for me, but I will be no more.”

1.verse: Bildad’s First Speech -Chapter 8 -Does God Pervert Justice? -Then Bildad the Shuhite spoke up and said:

2.verse: “How long will you say such things?The words of your mouth are like a turbulent wind.

3.verse: Does God pervert justice?Does the Almighty distort the truth?

4.verse: If your children sinned against him,he has delivered them into the power of their transgressions.

5.verse: “If you yourself will now seek Godas one who is pure and uprightand make supplication to the Almighty,

6.verse: then he will rouse himself on your behalfand restore the prosperity of your house.

7.verse: Your former state will seem inconsequentialin the light of your future prosperity.

8.verse: Inquire Now of Former Generations -“Inquire now of former generationsand reflect on what their ancestors came to realize.

9.verse: For we are only born yesterday and know nothing,since our days on earth are but a shadow.

10.verse: Will they not instruct you and tell you,and utter words out of their understanding?

11.verse: “Can a papyrus flourish where there is no marsh?Can reeds grow without water?

12.verse: While yet green and not cut down,they wither more quickly than any plant.

13.verse: Such is the fate of all those who forget God;thus the hope of the godless man will perish.

14.verse: His confidence is only a thread,his trust a spider’s web.

15.verse: If he leans against his house, it will begin to totter;if he clings to it, it will not endure.

16.verse: “At dawn he seems quite strong and virile,like a plant whose young roots spread out over the garden.

17.verse: His roots are entwined around a pile of stones;he draws his strength from among the rocks.

18.verse: But if someone uproots him from his place,it will disown him, saying, ‘I have never seen you.’

19.verse: There he lies, rotting along the roadside,and others will sprout forth from the soil.

20.verse: “Be assured, God will not reject a blameless person,nor will he grasp the hand of the wrongdoer.

21.verse: He will yet fill your mouth with laughterand your lips with joyful cries.

22.verse: Those who hate you will be covered with shame,and the tent of the wicked will cease to exist.”

1.verse: Job’s Second Response -Chapter 9 -The Irresistible Power of God. -Job then answered with these words:

2.verse: “Indeed, I realize that this is true,but how can anyone claim to be righteous before God?

3.verse: If someone wished to debate with him,he could not answer him once in a thousand.

4.verse: God is wise in heart and mighty in strength;who then has resisted him and remained unscathed?

5.verse: “He moves mountains without their realizing itand overturns them in his anger.

6.verse: He shakes the earth out of its place,and makes its pillars tremble.

7.verse: He commands the sun, and it does not rise;he seals up the light of the stars.

8.verse: He alone stretches out the heavensand tramples upon the waves of the sea.

9.verse: He made the Bear and Orion,the Pleiades and the constellations of the South.

10.verse: “God performs deeds that are beyond understandingand marvels that cannot be numbered.

11.verse: If he passes near me, I do not see him;he moves on, imperceptible to me.

12.verse: If he snatches something away, who can stop him?Who will dare to ask him, ‘What are you doing?’

13.verse: God will not relent in his wrath;the servants of Rahab lie prostrate at his feet.

14.verse: Even If I Am Innocent, How Can I Answer God? -“How then can I possibly reply to himor devise arguments to counter him?

15.verse: Even if I am innocent, how can I answer him?I can only plead that he have mercy on me.

16.verse: “Even if I summoned him and he responded,I do not believe that he would listen to what I said.

17.verse: He might crush me in a tempestand multiply my wounds without cause.

18.verse: He might leave me no opportunity to regain my breathand fill me with bitterness.

19.verse: “If it is a contest of strength,I cannot compete with him.If it is a matter of judgment,who can summon him to present his evidence?

20.verse: Even though I am innocent,my own mouth might condemn me.Even though I am blameless,he might prove me guilty.

21.verse: But am I without blame?I am no longer certain.Life itself I despise.

22.verse: “It is all the same; that is why I say,‘He destroys both the innocent and the wicked.’

23.verse: When a deadly scourge suddenly appears,he mocks the despair of the innocent.

24.verse: When the earth is given into the hands of the wicked,he blindfolds the eyes of its judges.If it is not he who does so,then who else is responsible?

25.verse: There Is No Arbiter To Judge between God and Me -“My days pass more swiftly than a runner;they fly away without any experience of happiness.

26.verse: They skim past like boats of papyrus,like an eagle swooping upon its prey.

27.verse: If I say, ‘I will forget my complaints,I will put on a cheerful face instead of a sad countenance,’

28.verse: I will still dread my sufferings,for I know that you will not hold me innocent.

29.verse: “If I am to be condemned as guilty,why then should I struggle in vain?

30.verse: If I should wash myself with snowand cleanse my hands with lye,

31.verse: you would plunge me into a dung-filled ditchso that even my clothes would abhor me.

32.verse: “For God is not a man like me,someone before whom I can plead my caseor whom I can confront in a court.

33.verse: There is no arbiter to judge between uswith the power to render a verdict,

34.verse: someone who could remove God’s rod from meso that I would not shrink from him in terror.

35.verse: Then I would speak out without fear of him,for I know I am not what I am thought to be.

1.verse: Chapter 10 -Tell Me Why! -“I loathe my very life;therefore I will give free rein to my complaintsand speak out in the bitterness of my soul.

2.verse: I will say to God: ‘Do not condemn me,but simply let me know what is your charge against me.

3.verse: Do you get any joy in oppressing me,spurning the work of your own handswhile approving the schemes of the wicked?

4.verse: “ ‘Do you have eyes of flesh?Do you see as a mortal sees?

5.verse: Are your days like those of a mortal,or your years like those of a man,

6.verse: that you investigate my iniquityand keep a record of my sins,

7.verse: even though you know that I am innocentand have no one to rescue me from your hand?

8.verse: I Realize What Was Your Intent -“ ‘Your hands created and fashioned me;will you now turn away and destroy me?

9.verse: Remember that you fashioned me like clay;will you now reduce me again to dust?

10.verse: Did you not pour me out like milkand curdle me like cheese?

11.verse: You clothed me with skin and fleshand knit me together with bones and sinews.

12.verse: “ ‘You have given me life and kindness,and in your providence you have preserved my spirit.

13.verse: Yet within your heart you had a secret plan,and I realize what was your intent:

14.verse: you would be watching me,and if I sinned, you would not absolve me of my guilt.

15.verse: “ ‘Woe to me if I should be wicked.Even if I am righteous, I dare not lift up my head,for I am filled with shameand bent over with affliction.

16.verse: Should I lift up my head, you hunt me like a proud lion,confronting me time and again with your awesome power.

17.verse: You renew your onslaughts against me,your fury increasing incessantlyas fresh troops assail me wave after wave.

18.verse: Let Me Alone So That I May Have a Few Moments of Happiness -“ ‘Why did you bring me forth from the womb?It would have been better if I had diedbefore an eye had beheld me,

19.verse: and had been carried from the womb to the graveas though I had never existed.

20.verse: Do I not have but a few remaining days of life?Let me alone so that I may have a few moments of happiness

21.verse: before I go to the place of no return,to the land of gloom and darkness,

22.verse: to the land of deepest night,a land of gloom and disorder,where even the light is like darkness.’ ”

1.verse: Zophar’s First Speech -Chapter 11 -God Recognizes the Deceitful. -Then Zophar the Naamathite responded:

2.verse: “Should we allow this torrent of words to go unanswered?Is a clever speaker always to be considered right?

3.verse: Should your endless talk reduce others to silence?When you mock, is no one allowed to refute you?

4.verse: For you said, ‘My judgments are irrefutableand I am blameless in the sight of God.’

5.verse: Oh, how I wish that God would speakand open his lips to contradict your opinions

6.verse: while revealing to you the secrets of wisdom,which puts human intelligence to shame.Thus, you might knowthat God will call you to account for your sin.

7.verse: “Can you fathom the mysteries of God?Can you attain to the perfection of the Almighty?

8.verse: It is higher than the heavens—what can you do?It is deeper than the netherworld—what can you know?

9.verse: Its measure is longer than the earthand broader than the sea.

10.verse: “If while passing by he decides to imprison youor subject you to judgment, who can prevent him?

11.verse: He surely recognizes the deceitful;he will hardly ignore their iniquity.

12.verse: An ignorant fool can no more gain understandingthan a wild donkey can be domesticated.

13.verse: Stretch Out Your Hands toward God -“However, if you will have a change of heartand stretch out your hands toward him in prayer,

14.verse: if you banish all iniquity far away from youand do not allow wickedness to penetrate your tent,

15.verse: you will then be able to lift up your face in innocence;you will be unwavering and without fear.

16.verse: You will then forget your wretchedness,remembering it only as flood waters gone by.

17.verse: “Then your life will be brighter than noonday,and its darkness will be like morning.

18.verse: You will be filled with confidence because there is hope;you will look around and take your rest in safety.

19.verse: You will lie down without fearing anyone,and many will seek your favor.

20.verse: But the eyes of the wicked will fail;for them all the ways of escape will be closed,and all they can hope for is death.”

1.verse: Job’s Third Response -Chapter 12 -Wisdom Will Die with You. -Job then answered with these words:

2.verse: “Undoubtedly, you are the voice of the people,and when you die, wisdom will die with you.

3.verse: But I also have intelligence;I am not inferior to you in this regard.Who is ignorant of all these things?

4.verse: “I have become a laughingstock to my friends,I whom God would answer when I called upon him;although I am innocent and just, he afflicted me.

5.verse: Those who live untroubled lives scorn the misfortunes of others,the blows that strike those who are already staggering.

6.verse: Yet the tents of robbers remain undisturbed,and those who provoke God sleep securelyas well as those who make a god of their strength.

7.verse: “But ask the animals, and they will teach you;ask the birds of the air, and they will inform you.

8.verse: Ask the reptiles on earth, and they will instruct you,or let the fish of the sea enlighten you.

9.verse: Which of all these is unawarethat the hand of God has done this?

10.verse: “In God’s hand is the soul of every living thingand the breath of all mankind.

11.verse: Does not the ear test wordsas the palate tastes food?

12.verse: Wisdom is found in the aged,and long life nourishes understanding.

13.verse: With God Are Wisdom and Power -“With God are wisdom and power;wise counsel and understanding are his.

14.verse: If he tears down, no one can rebuild;anyone he imprisons cannot gain freedom.

15.verse: If he holds back the waters, drought ensues;if he releases them, the land is overwhelmed.

16.verse: Strength and wisdom are his;his too are the deceived and the deceivers.

17.verse: “He deprives counselors of their witsand makes fools of judges.

18.verse: He looses the sashes of kingsand gives them only a waistcloth to cover their loins.

19.verse: He forces priests to walk barefootand overthrows those in positions of power.

20.verse: He silences the lips of trusted counselorsand deprives the aged of their power of discernment.

21.verse: “He pours contempt on princesand disarms the powerful.

22.verse: He unveils mysteries long obscured in darknessand brings their meaning to light.

23.verse: He makes nations great and then destroys them;he enlarges nations and then reduces them to nothing.

24.verse: He weakens the minds of the leaders of the earthand leaves them to wander in a trackless waste.

25.verse: They grope their way in the darkness without light,staggering like drunken men.

1.verse: Chapter 13 -Be Silent—I Want To Question God -“All this I have observed with my own eyes;my ears have heard and understood it.

2.verse: What you know, I also know;I am not inferior to you in any way.

3.verse: But I only wish to speak with the Almightyand to argue my case with God.

4.verse: As for you, you are obscuring the truth with lies,and the solutions you offer are all worthless.

5.verse: “Oh, if only you would be completely silent!For you, that would be regarded as wisdom.

6.verse: Hear now my reasoningand listen to the plea that issues from my lips.

7.verse: Is it on God’s behalf that you utter lies?Is it in his defense that you speak deceitfully?

8.verse: Will you show partiality for himas you plead his case?

9.verse: “Will you feel totally comfortable when he examines you?Will you be able to deceive him as you deceive men?

10.verse: If you show partiality, even though not flagrant,he will surely rebuke you.

11.verse: Will not his majesty frighten youand the fear of him overcome you?

12.verse: The ideas you propose are proverbs of ash;your arguments are defenses of clay.

13.verse: “Be silent so that I may speak on my own behalf.Then let what may come upon me.

14.verse: I am taking my life in my own handsand placing myself in jeopardy.

15.verse: Perhaps he may slay me, but I have no other hopethan to defend my conduct before him.

16.verse: This will prove to be my salvation,for the godless will not dare to come before him.

17.verse: I Am Certain That I Will Be Vindicated -“Therefore, listen carefully to my wordsand give my defense a careful hearing.

18.verse: I have prepared my case carefully,and I am certain that I will be vindicated.

19.verse: If anyone can make a valid case against me,then I will be silent and die.

20.verse: “Only grant me two things, O God,and then I will not hide myself from your face:

21.verse: just withdraw your hand far from me,and stop frightening me with your terrors.

22.verse: Then summon me, and I will answer,or let me speak first, and then you can reply.

23.verse: “Of how many crimes and sins am I guilty?Make known to me my faults and my transgressions.

24.verse: Why do you hide your faceand look upon me as your enemy?

25.verse: Will you harass a wind-blown leafand chase after dry chaff?

26.verse: “For you have drawn up bitter charges against meand caused me to suffer for the iniquities of my youth,

27.verse: putting my feet in the stocksand keeping a close watch on every step I takeas you trace all my footprints.

28.verse: Thus, I waste away like rotting woodor like a moth-eaten garment.

1.verse: Chapter 14 -Everyone Born of Woman . . . -“Everyone born of womanhas life that is short and filled with troubles.

2.verse: He blossoms like a flower and soon begins to wither;as fleeting as a shadow, he does not endure.

3.verse: Is it upon a creature like this that you fix your gazeand bring him before you to be judged?

4.verse: “Can a man be found who has avoided defilement?There is no such person.

5.verse: The extent of his life has already been determined,and the number of his months is known to you;you have established the limits that he cannot pass.

6.verse: Turn your gaze away from him and leave him aloneso that, like a hired laborer, he may complete his days.

7.verse: “At least for a tree there is always hope:if it is cut down, it may sprout once again,and its new shoots may burst with life.

8.verse: Although its roots age in the earthand its stump dies in the ground,

9.verse: once it scents water it will begin to budand put forth branches like a sapling.

10.verse: “But when a man dies, he remains lifeless;what is his fate once he expires?

11.verse: As occurs when the waters of a lake recedeor a river ceases to flow and runs dry,

12.verse: so men lie down and never rise again;until the heavens cease to exist, they will not awakenor be stirred out of their slumber.

13.verse: Hide Me in the Netherworld -“How I wish you would hide me in the netherworldand shelter me until your wrath has subsidedwhile designating a time to call me to mind.

14.verse: If one who dies were permitted to live once again,I would willingly endure all the days of my servicewaiting for my relief to arrive.

15.verse: You would call and I would answer you;you would long to see once again the creature you have made.

16.verse: You would count my every stepbut not watch for any evidence of sin in me.

17.verse: You would store up all my transgressions in a bag,and you would cover over my guilt.

18.verse: “But as a mountain eventually fallsand a rock is removed from its place,

19.verse: as the waters wear away the stonesand cloudbursts wash away the soil,so you destroy the hope of man.

20.verse: You crush him once for all and he disappears;you alter his appearance and send him away.

21.verse: If his sons are honored, he is unaware of it;if they are disgraced, he does not know it.

22.verse: He is cognizant only of the pains his flesh endures,and he grieves for no one except himself.”

1.verse: Second Cycle of Speeches -Eliphaz’s Second Speech -Chapter 15 -You in Fact Discredit Religion. -Then Eliphaz the Temanite responded:

2.verse: “Would a wise man respond with empty argumentsand make himself a windbag?

3.verse: Would he fill his defense with pointless talkand speeches that serve no purpose?

4.verse: “You in fact discredit religionand do away with devotion to God,

5.verse: because your iniquity dictates what you sayand you choose to exhibit a deceitful tongue.

6.verse: Your own mouth condemns you, not I;your own lips testify against you.

7.verse: Are You the Firstborn of the Human Race? -“Are you the firstborn of the human race?Did you come into existence before the hills?

8.verse: Are you a member of God’s inner council?Do you have a monopoly on wisdom?

9.verse: What do you know that we do not know?What insight do you have that we do not share?

10.verse: We ourselves have age and gray hair on our side,people who far surpass your father in years.

11.verse: “Are the consolations that God offers insufficient for you,words whispered gently in your ear?

12.verse: Why do you allow your passions to erode your judgment,and why do your eyes flash with anger

13.verse: so that you vent your rage against Godand permit such words to escape your mouth?

14.verse: “What is man, that he should be without fault,or one born of woman, that he should be righteous?

15.verse: If God places no trust in his holy onesand the heavens are not pure in his sight,

16.verse: how much less is man, who is vile and corruptand drinks up iniquity like water?

17.verse: Listen to Experience and Tradition -“I will tell you; listen to me.I will recount what I have seen,

18.verse: what has been related by wise menwho have faithfully transmitted the teachings of their ancestors,

19.verse: to whom alone the land was given,and no foreigner passed among them.

20.verse: “The wicked man suffers torment all his days,and limited are the years allotted to the tyrant.

21.verse: Terrifying sounds echo in his ears,and even when times are peaceful, marauders swoop down on him.

22.verse: He despairs of escaping the darknessand realizes that he is destined for the sword.

23.verse: “In his wandering, he serves as food for vulturesand knows the day of darkness is at hand.

24.verse: Distress and anguish overwhelm him;they overpower him like a king prepared to attack.

25.verse: “Because he has lifted his hands against Godand acted in brazen defiance of the Almighty,

26.verse: rushing stubbornly against himwith his massive embossed shield,

27.verse: with his jowls heavy and grossand his waist bulging with fat,

28.verse: he will dwell in cities that lie in ruins,in houses that have been abandonedand are crumbling into a heap of rubble.

29.verse: “He will no longer be wealthy and his riches will not endure;no longer will his power prevail.

30.verse: He will not escape the darkness;intense heat will shrivel his roots,and the wind will cause his blossoms to disappear.

31.verse: Let him not deceive himself by trusting in what is worthless,for he will be left bereft.

32.verse: “His palm trees will wither before their time,and his branches will never again be green.

33.verse: He will be like a vine that sheds unripe grapes,like an olive tree casting off its blossoms.

34.verse: For the company of the godless will be completely barren,and fire will consume the tents of those who are venal.

35.verse: They conceive malice and breed evil,and they give birth to deceit.”

1.verse: Job’s Fourth Response -Chapter 16 -If You Were in My Place . . . -Job then answered with these words:

2.verse: “I have heard similar comments on many occasions;what wretched comforters you all are!

3.verse: When will you cease your endless flow of foolish words?Or what sickness afflicts you that you never cease babbling?

4.verse: “I could also rant on as you do,if you were in my place.I could exhaust you with my wordsand shake my head at you.

5.verse: But I would offer words of encouragement,and comfort from my lips would alleviate your pain.

6.verse: When I speak, my suffering is not eased,and if I remain silent, my pain does not stop.

7.verse: You Have Risen Up as a Witness against Me -“Truly, my pain has left me exhausted,and you have devastated my entire family.

8.verse: You have risen up as a witness against me;my gaunt appearance offers clear testimony to my plight.

9.verse: Your anger has caused you to assail me,and you gnash your teeth against me.My enemies lord it over me;

10.verse: they open their mouths to mock me.They strike me insolently on the cheek;they have all joined in league against me.

11.verse: “God has left me as prey for the godlessand handed me over to the power of the wicked.

12.verse: I was living at peace until he crushed me;he seized me by the neck and broke me into pieces,setting me up as a target.

13.verse: His archers encompass me on every side;he pierces my loins without mercyand pours out my gall upon the ground.

14.verse: He repeatedly bludgeons his way through my defensesand rushes upon me like a warrior.

15.verse: My Witness Is in Heaven -“I have sewn sackcloth over my skinand laid my forehead in the dust.

16.verse: My face is red from incessant weeping,and dark shadows ring my eyelids,

17.verse: even though my hands are free of violenceand my prayer is pure.

18.verse: “O earth, do not cover my blood;let my cries never cease to be heard.

19.verse: Even now my witness is in heaven;my defender is on high.

20.verse: Although my friends scorn me,I pour out tears before God,

21.verse: pleading that he may listen to meas a person would listen to a neighbor.

22.verse: For there are only a few years left to mebefore I set forth on that journeyfrom which there is no return.

1.verse: Chapter 17 -Where Then Will My Hope Be? -“My spirit is broken,my days are numbered,and the grave is ready to receive me.

2.verse: I am surrounded by mockers who taunt me,and my eyes dwell on their hostility.

3.verse: “I call upon you to be a witness on my behalf,for there is no one else to whom I can turn.

4.verse: You have closed the minds of others to reason,but surely you will not allow them to triumph.

5.verse: “Like a man who invites others to dine with him,while the eyes of his children are failing,

6.verse: I have become a byword in every land,someone people spit upon.

7.verse: My eyes have become increasingly blinded with grief,and all my members have been reduced to a shadow.

8.verse: The righteous are appalled at this,and the innocent are indignant at the wicked.

9.verse: The upright continue to adhere to a righteous path,and those whose hands are pure will grow stronger.

10.verse: “Even so, come forward, all of you, and continue your attack.I will not find even one man among you who is wise.

11.verse: My days have passed and my plans are foiled;the strings of my heart have been severed.

12.verse: My enemies would have me believe that night is dayand that the light will soon eradicate the darkness.

13.verse: “If I foresee the netherworld as my dwelling,if I spread out my bed in the darkness,

14.verse: if I call the grave my fatherand the worm my mother or my sister,

15.verse: where then will my hope be,and who can foresee any happiness for me?

16.verse: Will they accompany me to the netherworld?Will we descend together into the dust?”

1.verse: Bildad’s Second Speech -Chapter 18 -The Light of the Wicked Is Extinguished. -Then Bildad the Shuhite responded:

2.verse: “When will you cease this torrent of words?Once you start to think rationally,then we can have a sensible discussion.

3.verse: Why do you treat us like animalsand regard us as ignorant?

4.verse: In your anger you tear yourself to pieces,but the earth will not be forsaken on your account,nor will a single rock be moved from its place.

5.verse: “The light of the wicked is extinguished,and the flame of his fire no longer shines.

6.verse: The light in his tent begins to fadeand the lamp above him is put out.

7.verse: His vigorous stride begins to falterand his own plans fail miserably.

8.verse: He rushes headlong into a net,and his feet are ensnared.

9.verse: “A trap seizes him by the heel,leaving him unable to escape.

10.verse: A noose lies hidden on the ground for him;pitfalls lie across his path.

11.verse: Terrors alarm him on every side,hounding his every step.

12.verse: His strength is weakened by hunger,and disaster awaits him on all sides.

13.verse: “His skin is eaten away by disease;the firstborn of death devours his limbs.

14.verse: He is dragged from the security of his tentand carted off to the king of terrors.

15.verse: Anyone can live in his tent since it is no longer his;brimstone is scattered over his dwelling.

16.verse: His roots dry up below,and his branches wither above.

17.verse: “All memory of him vanishes from the earth;his name is quickly forgotten.

18.verse: He is thrust from light into darknessand banished from the world.

19.verse: He leaves no offspring or posterity among his people;there is no survivor where he once lived.

20.verse: Inhabitants of the west are appalled at his fate,while those of the east are struck with horror.

21.verse: Such indeed is the dwelling of the impious;such is the home of everyone who cares nothing for God.”

1.verse: Job’s Fifth Response -Chapter 19 -God Has Wronged Me. -Job then answered with these words:

2.verse: “How much longer will you torment meand oppress me with your words?

3.verse: You have reproached me now ten times,and you mistreat me shamelessly.

4.verse: And even if it were true that I have erred,the fault would be completely mine.

5.verse: “If indeed you want to exalt yourselves above meand use my humiliation against me,

6.verse: know that God has wronged meand cast his net over me.

7.verse: Even when I protest that I have been wronged,no one comes forward to support me,and I receive no justice when I cry out for help.

8.verse: “He has blocked my path so that I cannot pass,and he has shrouded my way in darkness.

9.verse: He has deprived me of my honorand removed the crown from my head.

10.verse: He assails me on every side until I succumb;he has uprooted my hope like a tree.

11.verse: He has inflamed his anger against meand looks upon me as his enemy.

12.verse: His troops move forward as a single force;they have surrounded me with siegeworksand encamped around my tent.

13.verse: “He has caused my brethren to turn against me;my friends are completely estranged from me.

14.verse: My relatives and my companions now ignore me,and those who were guests in my house have forgotten me.

15.verse: Even my serving girls regard me as a stranger;I have become an alien in their eyes.

16.verse: When I summon my servant, he does not respond,no matter how much I plead with him.

17.verse: “My wife finds my breath repulsive;my stench is loathsome to my relatives.

18.verse: Even young children despise me;when I approach, they turn their backs on me.

19.verse: All of my dearest friends abhor me;those I love have turned against me.

20.verse: I have become just skin and bonesand have escaped with only my gums.

21.verse: “Have pity on me, my friends, have pity on me,for the hand of God has touched me.

22.verse: Must you pursue me just as God does?Will not my flesh ever be enough to satisfy you?

23.verse: I Know That My Redeemer Lives -“How I wish that my words might be written downand inscribed on a scroll!

24.verse: How I wish that with an iron chisel and with leadthey were engraved in stone forever!

25.verse: “But I know that my Redeemer lives,and that at the end he will stand upon the dust.

26.verse: After my awakening, he will call me close to him,and then from my own flesh I will see God.

27.verse: I will see him with my own eyes;my eyes, not those of another, will behold him.How my heart within me yearns for that moment!

28.verse: “As for you who say,‘How we will persecute him,for the root of the trouble lies in him,’

29.verse: beware of the sword that is pointed toward you,for the avenger of wickedness is the sword,and then you will know that there is indeed a judgment.”

1.verse: Zophar’s Second Speech -Chapter 20 -The Joy of a Sinner Lasts Only for a Moment. -Then Zophar the Naamathite replied:

2.verse: “The words you have spoken have caused me great distress,and as a result, I am forced to reply.

3.verse: I have been outraged by your censure,but now a spirit beyond my understandingprovides me with the answers to rebuke you.

4.verse: “Surely you must know that since time beganand man was first placed on the earth,

5.verse: the triumph of the wicked has always been short-lived,and the joy of the sinner lasts only for a moment.

6.verse: Even though in his pride he towers to the skyand his head touches the clouds,

7.verse: he is destined to perish forever like his own dung,and those who used to see him will ask:‘Where is he?’

8.verse: He will fade away like a dream and never be found again;he will vanish like a vision of the night.

9.verse: The eyes that saw him will see him no more,and his dwelling will not behold him any longer.

10.verse: He Wolfs Down Riches and Then Vomits Them Up -“His children will seek the favor of the poor,and his hands will be forced to return his wealth.

11.verse: The youthful vigor that once filled his bodywill be stagnant with him in the earth.

12.verse: “Though wickedness is sweet in his mouthand he hides it under his tongue,

13.verse: though he continues to keep it in his mouthand is loath to let it go,

14.verse: yet such food will turn sour in his stomach,working inside him like the venom of asps.

15.verse: He wolfs down riches and then vomits them up;God forces him to disgorge them from his stomach.

16.verse: “Such a person will suck the venom of asps;the tongue of a viper will slay him.

17.verse: He will see no streams of oilor rivers flowing with honey and cream.

18.verse: He will be forced to restore his gains without enjoying them;even though his wealth increased, he will derive no enjoyment.

19.verse: For he has oppressed the poor and left them destitute,seizing houses that he did not build.

20.verse: “Since his avarice could never be satisfied,no amount of hoarding will save him.

21.verse: Since his greed was insatiable,his prosperity will not endure.

22.verse: When he possesses everything he desires,his troubles will begin,and the full force of misery will strike him down.

23.verse: “God will unleash the fury of his wrath against himand rain down upon him a hail of arrows.

24.verse: If he escapes a weapon of iron,a bow of bronze will pierce him through.

25.verse: The tip of the arrow will protrude from his bodyand the glittering point will emerge from his bladder;terrors will descend upon him.

26.verse: “Unrelieved darkness is what awaits him;a fire that does not need to be fanned will devour him,and anything left in his tent will be consumed.

27.verse: The heavens will lay bare his iniquity,and the earth will rise up against him.

28.verse: Flood waters will sweep away his houselike the torrents on the day of God’s wrath.

29.verse: This is the lot that God reserves for the wicked,the heritage assigned to him by God.”

1.verse: Job’s Sixth Response -Chapter 21 -The Very Thought of My Plight Fills Me with Horror. -Job then answered with these words:

2.verse: “Listen carefully to my words;at the very least, grant me this consolation.

3.verse: Bear with me while I speak;once I have finished, you may jeer.

4.verse: “Is my complaint limited to my fellow men?Do I not have good reason to be impatient?

5.verse: If you consider my plight carefully,you will have good reason to be appalledand to place your hand over your mouth.

6.verse: The very thought of it fills me with horror,and my entire body shudders.

7.verse: Why Do the Wicked Continue To Survive? -“Why do the wicked continue to survive,achieving old age and increasing in power?

8.verse: They behold their children established around themand their descendants continuing to flourish.

9.verse: Their households are secure, with no cause for fear;the rod of God does not descend upon them.

10.verse: Their bulls breed without fail;their cows give birth without miscarriage.

11.verse: “The wicked send forth children as a flock;their little ones dance and frolic.

12.verse: They sing to the sound of the tambourine and the harpand rejoice at the playing of the flute.

13.verse: They spend their days in prosperityand go down to the netherworld in peace.

14.verse: They Say to God, “Leave Us Alone!” -“Despite this, these people say to God,‘Leave us alone!We do not want to learn your ways.

15.verse: Who is the Almighty that we should serve him?And what would we gain by praying to him?’

16.verse: Is not the prosperity of the wickedthe result of their own efforts,since they have never sought God’s help?

17.verse: How Often? -“Yet, how often is the lamp of the wicked extinguished?How often does calamity befall themas God in his anger uses his retribution to repay them?

18.verse: How often are they like straw blown away by the windor like chaff that the storm carries off?

19.verse: What Concern Will He Have for His Family? -“According to you, God stores up punishment for a man’s children,but the wicked should be the ones punished and requited for their evil.

20.verse: Let his own eyes witness the destruction of Godthat his sins have earned,and let him quaff the wrath of the Almighty!

21.verse: For what concern will he have for his familyonce his allotted number of months has been completed?

22.verse: All Are Consigned To Lie Down in the Earth -“Who can offer wisdom to Godwhen God judges those who are on high?

23.verse: One man passes away while enjoying vigorous health,blessed with security and contentment;

24.verse: his loins are full of vigorand his bones are rich in marrow.

25.verse: Another dies in bitterness of soul,never having tasted happiness.

26.verse: Both are consigned to lie down in the earthand worms soon cover them.

27.verse: Have You Never Questioned Travelers? -“Believe me, I know what your thoughts are,as well as the arguments you will use to counter me.

28.verse: You will say, ‘Where now is the great lord’s house?Where is the tent in which the wicked man dwelled?’

29.verse: Have you never questioned travelers?Do you ever listen to the evidence they proffer?

30.verse: They testify that the wicked man is saved from disasterand is rescued before the day of wrath.

31.verse: “Who will reproach him for his conductand repay him for the evil he has done?

32.verse: When he is carried to the grave,a watch is maintained over his tomb.

33.verse: The clods of the valley are sweet to him;the remainder of mankind will follow him,and those who preceded him are beyond counting.

34.verse: How then can you possibly offer me any comfortwhen your words lack any semblance of truth?”

1.verse: Third Cycle of Speeches -Eliphaz’s Third Speech -Chapter 22 -Is God Punishing You for Your Piety? -Then Eliphaz the Temanite responded:

2.verse: “Can anyone be of the slightest interest to God,even if that person is recognized for his wisdom?

3.verse: Does the Almighty derive any pleasure if you are righteous?Does he profit if you lead a blameless life?

4.verse: Is he punishing you for your pietyand therefore will bring you to justice?

5.verse: Is not your wickedness great?Is there any limit to your iniquities?

6.verse: The Injustice Job Has Committed -“You have exacted pledges from your brothers as securityand left them naked, stripped of their clothing.

7.verse: To the thirsty you offered no water to drink,and you withheld bread from those who were starving.

8.verse: Should the land belong only to the powerful?Are only those who are favored allowed to dwell in it?

9.verse: “You have sent widows away empty-handedand left orphans without any means of support.

10.verse: That is why snares surround youand sudden terror causes you to cringe,

11.verse: why light has turned to darkness, leaving you unable to see,and flood waters envelop you.

12.verse: The Unbelief of Job -“Does not God who dwells in the heights of the heavensbehold how lofty are the highest stars?

13.verse: Even so, you say, ‘What does God know?How can he possibly judge through such deep darkness?

14.verse: He cannot possibly see through the thick cloudsas he roams through the vault of the heavens.’

15.verse: “Will you still continue to follow the ancient waythat those who are wicked have trod?

16.verse: They were snatched away before their time;their foundations were swept away by a flood.

17.verse: They had said to God, ‘Leave us alone!’and thought, ‘What can the Almighty do to us?’

18.verse: “Yet it was he who filled their houses with good things,even though his plans and theirs were diametrically opposed.

19.verse: The upright rejoice at witnessing such a spectacle,and the innocent deride them:

20.verse: ‘See how our enemies have been destroyed,and what remained of their wealth has been consumed by fire.’

21.verse: If You Return to the Almighty . . . -“Come to terms with God and be reconciled.In this way good fortune will come to you.

22.verse: Accept the instruction from his lipsand keep his words in your heart.

23.verse: If you return to the Almighty, you will be restored;if you remove iniquity from your tent

24.verse: and treat gold as if it were only dustand the gold of Ophir as pebbles from the stream,

25.verse: then the Almighty himself will be your goldand your precious silver.

26.verse: “For then the Almighty will be your delightand you will lift up your face to God.

27.verse: You will pray to him and he will hear you,and you will fulfill your vows.

28.verse: Whatever decision you make will be successful,and light will shine along your path.

29.verse: For God brings low the arrogantwhile he saves the humble.

30.verse: He delivers anyone who is innocent;if your hands are clean, you will be saved.”

1.verse: Job’s Seventh Response -Chapter 23 -If Only I Knew Where To Find God! -Job then answered with these words:

2.verse: “My complaint remains bitter;despite my groans, God’s hand lies heavy on me.

3.verse: Oh, if only I knew where to find himso that I might discover his dwelling.

4.verse: I would present my case before himand state arguments in my defense.

5.verse: “Then I would learn what he would answer me,and contemplate his words to me.

6.verse: He would not use his power to contend with me;he would only need to consider my arguments.

7.verse: There an upright man could reason with him,and I would receive a verdict of acquittal.

8.verse: “But if I go to the east, he is not there;if I go to the west, I cannot behold him.

9.verse: When I seek him in the north, I cannot find him;when I turn to the south, I catch no glimpse of him.

10.verse: God Has Caused My Courage To Fail -“And yet he is aware of everywhere I go;if he were to test me, I would emerge like pure gold.

11.verse: My footsteps have not strayed from the path he established;I have followed his way and never turned aside.

12.verse: I have not strayed from the commandments of his lips;I have treasured in my heart the words of his mouth.

13.verse: But once he has made a decision, who can oppose him?Whatever he desires, that he does.

14.verse: He will not turn aside from what he has planned for me,as is true of all his other decrees.

15.verse: “That is why I am in such fear of him;whenever I think of him, I am terrified.

16.verse: God has caused my courage to fail;the Almighty has filled me with dread.

17.verse: For darkness hides me from him,and obscurity veils his presence from me.

1.verse: Chapter 24 -The Injustice Crying Out in the World -“The actual day of judgment is known by the Almighty;why does he not reveal it to his faithful?

2.verse: Those who are wicked move boundary stones;they seize flocks and pasture them.

3.verse: They drive off the donkey belonging to the orphan;they take away the widow’s ox as security.

4.verse: They push aside the needy off the road;those who are destitute are forced into hiding.

5.verse: “Like wild donkeys of the wildernessthe poor go forth at dawnsearching the wasteland for foodwith which to feed their children.

6.verse: In the fields they reap what is not theirsand steal from the vineyards of the wicked.

7.verse: Without clothing, they spend the night naked,lacking anything to shelter them from the cold.

8.verse: They are soaked by the mountain rainand cling to the rocks as a source of shelter.

9.verse: “The fatherless child is snatched from the breastand carried off as a pledge of security.

10.verse: They go about their work naked, without clothing;despite their hunger they carry the sheaves.

11.verse: Along the pathways they press out the oil;they tread the winepresses but themselves suffer thirst.

12.verse: From the town the groans of the dying are heard,and those who are wounded cry out for help,yet God remains deaf to their prayer.

13.verse: “There also are those who rebel against the light;they are ignorant of its waysand refuse to frequent its paths.

14.verse: When nightfall descends, the murderer arisesto slay the poor and the needy;during the night he steals forth like a thief.

15.verse: “The eye of the adulterer also waits eagerly for twilight,thinking, ‘No eye will see me.’

16.verse: In the darkness men break into houses,but during the day they shut themselves in,for they are strangers to daylight.

17.verse: Deep darkness is morning to them;they only feel comfortable amid the terrors of the night.

18.verse: God Carefully Monitors the Conduct of the Mighty -“Such men are debris on the surface of the water;their portion in the land is accursed,and no laborer will toil in their vineyards.

19.verse: As drought and heat melt the snow,so does the netherworld cause sinners to disappear.

20.verse: The womb that shaped them remembers them no more,and the worm sucks them dry.

21.verse: “They maltreat the barren and childless womanand show no kindness to the widow.

22.verse: God may sustain the mighty through his strength,but he carefully monitors their conduct.

23.verse: He grants them a sense of security,but his eyes are fixed on their ways.

24.verse: They are exalted for a while,and then they are gone;they wither and fade like a flower,shriveling up like ears of grain.

25.verse: “If all this is not true, who will prove me wrongand show that my words are sheer nonsense?”

1.verse: Bildad’s Third Speech -Chapter 25 -God’s Dominance Inspires Terror. -Then Bildad the Shuhite responded:

2.verse: “Sovereignty and awe belong to Godwho has established peace in his realm on high.

3.verse: How can anyone number his forces?Upon whom does his light not arise?

4.verse: “How then can any man be righteous in God’s eyes?How can one born of woman be regarded as virtuous?

5.verse: If in his eyes the moon is not brightand the stars are not pure,

6.verse: how much less is man, who is a maggot,a son of man, who is a worm?”

1.verse: Job’s Eighth Response -Chapter 26 -How Profuse Is the Advice You Suggest! -Job then answered with these words:

2.verse: “What a help you are to the helpless,and what strength you are to the weak!

3.verse: What good counsel you give to the ignorant!How abundantly you have manifested wisdom!

4.verse: Who has helped you utter those words?And whose spirit issued forth from your mouth?

5.verse: God’s Mighty Works -“The dead below tremble with fright,as do the waters and all their inhabitants.

6.verse: The netherworld is laid bare before him,and Abaddon lies uncovered.

7.verse: “He stretches out the North above the voidand suspends the earth on nothingness.

8.verse: He encloses the waters in dense clouds,yet the clouds are not torn asunder under their weight.

9.verse: He veils the face of the full moon,spreading his clouds beneath it.

10.verse: “He has established the horizon on the surface of the watersas the boundary between light and darkness.

11.verse: The pillars of the heavens shake,stunned by the thunder of his voice.

12.verse: By his power he churns up the sea,and by his skill he smites Rahab.

13.verse: By his breath the skies are cleared,and by his hand he has pierced the fleeing serpent.

14.verse: “These deeds are only a sample of what he has done,and how faint is the whisper that we hear of him,but who can possibly comprehend the thunder of his power?”

1.verse: Chapter 27 -I Maintain the Rightness of My Cause. -Job then continued his discourse:

2.verse: “I swear by the living God who has denied me justice,and by the Almighty who has filled my soul with bitterness,

3.verse: that as long as I have a shred of life remaining in meand the breath of God is in my nostrils,

4.verse: never will my lips utter falsehood,nor will my tongue be guilty of deceit.

5.verse: “Never will I concede that you are right;until death I will not renounce my innocence.

6.verse: I maintain the rightness of my cause;my conscience does not reproach me for the life I have led.

7.verse: “Let my enemy meet the fate of the wickedand my adversary face the doom of the unjust.

8.verse: For what hope does a godless man have when he is cut off,when God takes away his life?

9.verse: Will God pay heed to his crywhen disaster comes upon him?

10.verse: Will he then take delight in the Almightyand call upon him at all times?

11.verse: “I will teach you about the power of God;I will not conceal the designs of the Almighty.

12.verse: Yet all of you have seen it yourselves;how then can you waste your time with idle words?”

13.verse: Zophar’s Third Speech -The Law of the Violent -“This is the fate that God allots for the wicked man,the inheritance that the violent receive from the Almighty.

14.verse: Though numerous, his children are destined for the sword,and his descendants will never have enough to eat.

15.verse: His survivors will perish as a result of pestilence,and their widows will not mourn for them.

16.verse: “Even though he amasses silver like dustand piles up clothes like clay,

17.verse: it is the righteous who will wear those clothesand the innocent who will divide the silver.

18.verse: The house he builds is as flimsy as a cobwebor like a shack that shelters the watchman.

19.verse: He goes to bed a man of wealth for the final time;he opens his eyes to find that it is all gone.

20.verse: “By day terror overtakes him,and at night a whirlwind carries him away.

21.verse: An east wind seizes him and he is gone;it sweeps him far away from his home.

22.verse: It assails him without pity,and he flees from its force that menaces him.

23.verse: His downfall is acclaimed with joy,and he is derided wherever he may be.

1.verse: The Praise of Wisdom -Chapter 28 -Where Can Wisdom Be Found? -“There are mines for silverand places where gold is refined.

2.verse: Iron is extracted from the earth,and copper is smelted from ore.

3.verse: Miners penetrate the darkness;they search to the farthest recessesto discover the ore hidden in gloom and shadow.

4.verse: They open shafts in uninhabited places,swinging suspended, far away from anyone.

5.verse: “While grain is coming forth from the earth above,what lies beneath is ravaged by fire.

6.verse: Its rocks are the enclosure for sapphires,and there is gold contained in its dust.

7.verse: No bird of prey knows the path there;the eye of a falcon has not seen it.

8.verse: Proud beasts have not trodden it;no lion has ever passed over it.

9.verse: “Man begins to assail the granite rockand overturns the mountains at their foundations.

10.verse: He cuts channels into the rocks,and his eyes behold precious gems.

11.verse: He explores the sources of the streamsand brings hidden riches to light.

12.verse: But where can wisdom be found?And where is the place of understanding?

13.verse: Wisdom Cannot Be Purchased -“No one knows the way to it,nor is it to be found in the land of the living.

14.verse: The abyss declares, ‘It is not in me.’The sea says, ‘I do not have it.’

15.verse: It cannot be purchased with gold,nor can its price be weighed out in silver.

16.verse: “It cannot be acquired with the gold of Ophir,nor with precious onyx or sapphire.

17.verse: Gold or crystal cannot be compared to it,nor can it be exchanged for vessels of gold.

18.verse: Neither coral nor alabaster deserve to be mentioned;the price of wisdom is beyond pearls.

19.verse: Topaz from Ethiopia is worthless in comparison to it,nor can it be valued in terms of pure gold.

20.verse: “Where then is the source of wisdom?Where is intelligence to be found?

21.verse: God Alone Knows Where Wisdom Can Be Found -“It cannot be seen by the eye of any living creature;it is even concealed from the birds of the air.

22.verse: Abaddon and the netherworld admit,‘We have only heard rumors of it.’

23.verse: “God alone understands the path to wisdom;he alone knows where it can be found.

24.verse: For he can observe the farthest ends of the earth,and he sees everything under the heavens.

25.verse: “When God regulated the force of the windand measured out the waters,

26.verse: when he imposed a limit for the rainand cleared a path for the thunderbolt,

27.verse: then he saw wisdom and evaluated it,established it and assessed it completely.

28.verse: And then he declared to man:‘The fear of the Lord is wisdom,and to turn from evil is understanding.’ ”

1.verse: Job’s Final Speech: His Appeal to God -Chapter 29 -The Happy Time. -Then Job continued further with his solemn discourse, as he said:

2.verse: “Oh, how I yearn for the months long goneand for those days when God kept watch over me,

3.verse: when his lamp continued to shine above my headand by his light I could walk through darkness.

4.verse: “In those days I was in my prime,and God protected my tent.

5.verse: The Almighty was ever present at my side,and my children were around me.

6.verse: My feet were bathed in milk,and the rocks poured forth streams of oil for me.

7.verse: “When I would go forth to the gate of the cityand take my seat in the public square,

8.verse: the young men would see me and withdraw,and the old men would rise to their feet.

9.verse: The nobles would refrain from speakingand would place their hands over their mouths.

10.verse: The voices of the princes were silenced,and their tongues stuck to the roof of their mouths.

11.verse: People Praised My Works -“Whoever heard my words spoke favorably of me,and those who saw me testified to my merit,

12.verse: because I delivered the poor who appealed for helpand the orphan who had no one to protect him.

13.verse: The blessing of the wretched was given to me,and I caused the widow’s heart to sing for joy.

14.verse: “I put on righteousness as my garment;justice was my cloak and my turban.

15.verse: I was eyes to the blindand feet to the lame.

16.verse: I was a father to the needy,and I defended the rights of the stranger.

17.verse: I broke the fangs of the wickedand snatched their prey from their teeth.

18.verse: “Then I thought, ‘I will die in honorafter having multiplied my days like grains of sand,

19.verse: with my roots spreading out to the watersand the dew lying on my branches throughout the night.

20.verse: My glory will be forever newand the bow in my hand forever strong.’

21.verse: “Men waited expectantly to hear my wordsand listened in silence to my counsel.

22.verse: Once I had spoken, no one spoke furtherbut simply let my thoughts penetrate their minds.

23.verse: They waited for me as for the rain,with open mouths as though to drink in a spring shower.

24.verse: “When I smiled at them, they were filled with gratitude,and they were clearly strengthened because of the way I treated them.

25.verse: As their leader I told them which course to follow,and I lived like a king among his troops,or as a comforter of mourners.

1.verse: Chapter 30 -Now I Am the Laughingstock -“But now I am the laughingstockof people who are younger than I,people whose fathers I would not have considered fitto put with the dogs guarding my flock.

2.verse: Of what use to me was the strength of their hands?Their vigor had completely wasted away.

3.verse: “Enfeebled by want and hunger,they gnawed roots in the wilderness,a gloomy place of dry and desolate ground.

4.verse: They plucked saltwort and scrub for food,and they ate the roots of the broom tree.

5.verse: Cast out from human societyand berated as thieves and pursued,

6.verse: they were forced to live on the sides of ravines,in holes in the ground, and in clefts of rock.

7.verse: Among the bushes you could hear them braying,huddled together under the nettles.

8.verse: They are a vile and irresponsible brood,driven as outcasts from society.

9.verse: “And these are the ones who speak mockingly about me;my name is a byword among them.

10.verse: They abhor me and keep their distance from me;they do not hesitate to spit in my face.

11.verse: And since God has loosened my bowspring and humbled me,they have ceased to have any restraint in my presence.

12.verse: “The rabble attack in a mob on my right flank;they lay snares for my feetand raise their siege-ramps against me.

13.verse: They advance through my crumbling defenses,blocking every means of escape,and no one restrains them.

14.verse: They burst forward through a gaping breachand advance in waves.

15.verse: Terrors surround me on all sides;my confidence disintegrates,and my hope of deliverance vanishes like a cloud.

16.verse: God’s Severity -“And now my life has begun to ebb away;my days are filled with grief and affliction.

17.verse: During the night pain wracks my bones,and I suffer from ceaseless throbbing that allows me no respite.

18.verse: God seizes my garment violently,grasping me by the collar of my tunic.

19.verse: He has cast me into the mire,and I am covered with dust and ashes.

20.verse: “I cry out to you, O God, but you do not answer me;I stand before you, but you barely take notice.

21.verse: You have turned with severity against me;with your strong hand you persecute me.

22.verse: You lift me up and place me at the mercy of the wind,allowing me to be tossed about in the storm.

23.verse: I know indeed that you will hand me over to deathand to the place appointed for every living mortal.

24.verse: Yet I Cannot Discover Why -“And yet should you not extend a handto someone who pleads with you for help?

25.verse: Did I not shed tears over the plight of the unfortunate?Was not my soul grieved for the destitute?

26.verse: Yet when I hoped for good, only evil came;when I looked for light, there was only darkness.

27.verse: My inward parts are in constant pain,and days of affliction torment me.

28.verse: “I walk about dejected and without comfort;I stand up in the assembly and cry for help.

29.verse: I have become a brother to the jackaland a companion to the ostrich.

30.verse: My skin has turned black and peels off my body,and my bones are scorched by heat.

31.verse: My harp has been tuned to dirges,and my flute to the sounds of weeping.

1.verse: Chapter 31 -Let God Weigh Me on Honest Scales -“I have made a covenant with my eyesnot to look with desire upon a virgin.

2.verse: For what is man’s lot prescribed by God above,his inheritance from the Almighty on high?

3.verse: Is it not destruction for the wickedand disaster for wrongdoers?

4.verse: Does not God see my waysand number all my steps?

5.verse: “If I have walked in falsehoodor hastened my steps toward deceit,

6.verse: let God weigh me on honest scales;then he will know that I am blameless.

7.verse: If My Steps Have Wandered . . . -“If my steps have wandered from the path of righteousness,or if my eyes have led my heart astray,or if any stain has besmirched my hands,

8.verse: then let someone else eat what I sow,and let my crops be uprooted.

9.verse: “If my heart has been enticed by a womanand I have lain in wait at my neighbor’s door,

10.verse: then let my wife grind grain for anotherand let other men enjoy her.

11.verse: For that would be a heinous crimeand judged as a criminal offense.

12.verse: It would be a fire that leads to Destructionuntil it consumes all my possessions completely.

13.verse: “If I have ever rejected the pleas of my male or female slaveswhen they lodged a complaint against me,

14.verse: what will I do when God confronts me?What will I answer if he calls me to account?

15.verse: Did not he who formed me in the womb also make them?Did not the one God create all human beings?

16.verse: “Have I ignored the needs of the pooror caused the eyes of widows to overflow with tears?

17.verse: Did I ever eat my bread alonewithout sharing it with an orphan,

18.verse: I whom God has reared like a fatherand guided ever since I left my mother’s womb?

19.verse: “Have I ever seen a stranger in need of clothing,or a poor wretch with nothing to cover him,

20.verse: whose body has not blessed meafter being warmed with the fleece of my sheep?

21.verse: Have I ever raised my hand against the innocent,knowing that my friends would support me?

22.verse: “If I have done any of these things,then let my shoulder blade fall from my shoulderand let my arm be torn from its socket.

23.verse: For then the fear of God would overcome meand I would be unable to stand in his presence.

24.verse: “Have I placed my faith in goldand regarded it as my security?

25.verse: Have I rejoiced in my great wealthand the abundance of riches in my possession?

26.verse: Have I beheld the sun when it shoneand the moon moving in its splendor

27.verse: and ever found my heart to be secretly enticedso that I blew them a kiss in homage?

28.verse: Any of these would be a serious offense,for I would have been unfaithful to God above.

29.verse: “Have I ever rejoiced at the ruin of my enemyor exulted when evil overtook him—

30.verse: I who would not allow my tongue to sinby laying his life under a curse?

31.verse: Have not those of my household said,‘Who has not eaten his meat and been sated?’

32.verse: No stranger has ever had to spend the night in the street;my door has always been open to the traveler.

33.verse: “Have I ever concealed my transgressions as others do,keeping my guilt buried within my breast,

34.verse: because I feared the gossip that would ensue,and I was terrified at the scorn of the multitude?If so, then I would have remained silentand not ventured out of doors.

35.verse: May God Respond -“Oh, if only I had someone to hear my defenseand my accuser would write out his indictment!

36.verse: I would wear it on my shoulderand place it on my head as a crown.

37.verse: I would give him an account of my entire life,and like a prince I would present myself before him.

38.verse: Concluding Oath -“If my land has cried out against meand its furrows have joined in the weeping,

39.verse: if I have eaten its produce without paymentand caused the death of its owners,

40.verse: then let thistles grow instead of wheatand noxious weeds instead of barley.”The words of Job are ended.

1.verse: The Four Speeches of Elihu -Chapter 32 -Elihu’s Indignation Is Aroused. -The three men then ceased to argue with Job because in his own eyes he was righteous.

2.verse: Then Elihu, the son of Barachel the Buzite, of the family of Ram, became very angry. He was furious because Job believed that he was righteous and that God was in error.

3.verse: And he was also angry at Job’s three friends because they had never devised an answer to refute Job and thus had allowed God to appear to be wrong.

4.verse: While Job and his friends had been conversing, Elihu had refrained from addressing Job, since the three companions were older than he.
