5.verse: But when Elihu perceived that the three had no answer to offer, he could no longer contain his anger.

6.verse: Elihu’s First Speech -I Have Many Things To Say. -Therefore Elihu, the son of Barachel the Buzite, began to speak.“I am young in years,and you are old.Therefore, I held my tongueand hesitated to express my opinion to you.

7.verse: I thought, ‘Age ought to speak;many years will result in conveying wisdom.’

8.verse: “But it is the spirit in a man,the breath of the Almighty,that gives him understanding.

9.verse: It is not only the old who are wise;it is not only the aged who understand what is right.

10.verse: Therefore, I beg you to listen to meand allow me to declare my opinion.

11.verse: “I have been waiting to hear what you had to say,and I listened attentively to your argumentsas each one of you chose your words with care.

12.verse: I gave you my close attention,but there is not one of you who has convicted Jobor refuted his statements.

13.verse: Therefore, do not say, ‘We have found wisdom;let God confute him, not men!’

14.verse: Job has not addressed his words to me;therefore, I will not answer him in the way you have done.

15.verse: “These three men are confounded and unable to respond;words have failed them.

16.verse: Am I then to wait because they do not speak,but simply stand there, stuck for an answer?

17.verse: I also will now have my say;it is my turn to express my opinion.

18.verse: For I have many things to say,and the spirit within me forces me to speak.

19.verse: “I am ready to burst,like a new wineskin with wine searching for a vent.

20.verse: I must speak so that I may find relief;I must open my lips and reply.

21.verse: I will show no partiality to anyone,nor will I use flattering words.

22.verse: For I do not know how to flatter;if I did, my Maker would soon do away with me.

1.verse: Chapter 33 -God Is Greater Than Any Human Being -“Therefore, O Job, listen to my wordsand pay careful attention to everything I have to say.

2.verse: Behold, I have opened my mouth;the words are on the tip of my tongue.

3.verse: My words issue forth from an upright heart,and my lips will be sincere in what I say.

4.verse: The Spirit of God has made me,and the breath of the Almighty gives me life.

5.verse: “Refute me if you are able to do so;prepare your arguments and confront me.

6.verse: In the sight of God I am just like you;like you, I was formed from a piece of clay.

7.verse: Therefore, no fear of me should frighten you,nor should you feel any pressure on my account.

8.verse: “You have offered your defense in my presence,and I have listened carefully to the words you spoke.

9.verse: You said, ‘I am pure and without sin;I am clean, and there is no fault in me.

10.verse: Yet God continues to invent excuses against meand regards me as his enemy.

11.verse: He fastens my feet in shacklesand watches everything I do.’

12.verse: “In regard to this, I tell you, you are completely wrong.God is greater than any human being.

13.verse: Why then do you utter endless complaintsthat he will not explain his decisions to you?

14.verse: God Speaks in Many Ways -“For God does speak, first in one way and then in another,although we do not always perceive it.

15.verse: “In dreams and in visions of the night,when deep sleep falls upon menas they slumber on their beds,

16.verse: God then opens their earsand issues warnings that strike them with terror,

17.verse: so that he may turn man away from eviland check his pride.

18.verse: In this way he spares his soul from the pitand his life from a violent death.

19.verse: “Or again, he chastens him with pain upon his bedand with unceasing agony in his bones,

20.verse: so that he regards food with loathingand rejects the choicest dishes.

21.verse: His flesh is so wasted away that it cannot be seen,and his bones that once were invisible now begin to show.

22.verse: His soul draws nearer to the pitand his life to the abode of the dead.

23.verse: “But then, if there should be an angel on his side,one out of a thousand, a mediator,to show him what is right for himand expound God’s righteousness to him,

24.verse: he will take pity on him and say,‘Spare him from going down into the pit;I have the ransom for his life.’

25.verse: Then his flesh will regain its boyish freshness,and he will return to the days of his youthful vigor.

26.verse: “Then, if he entreats God to show him favorand allow him to enter his presence with joy,

27.verse: he will affirm before everyone,‘I sinned and departed from the path of righteousness,but God has not punished me as I deserved.

28.verse: He spared my soul from descending into the pit,and I will behold the light of life.’

29.verse: “God indeed does all these thingsagain and again for a man,

30.verse: bringing back his soul from the pitso that he may see the light of life.

31.verse: “Be attentive, Job, and listen to me;be silent and I will speak.

32.verse: If you have anything to say, then answer me;speak, for I desire to justify you.

33.verse: But if you have nothing to say, then listen to me;be silent and I will teach you wisdom.”

1.verse: Elihu’s Second Speech -Chapter 34 -Let Us Explore What Is Right. -Then Elihu continued and said:

2.verse: “Listen to my words, you wise men;you men of learning, hear what I have to say.

3.verse: For the ear tests the value of wordsas the palate does with food.

4.verse: “Let us consider together what is right;let us determine among ourselves what is good.

5.verse: For Job has said, ‘I am innocent,but God has denied me justice;

6.verse: I am in desperate straitsdespite the fact that I have done no wrong.’

7.verse: “Was there ever a man like Jobwith his thirst for blasphemous charges,

8.verse: who keeps company with evildoersand travels with wicked men?

9.verse: Did he not state that no one derives any benefitby being pleasing to God?

10.verse: God Does Not Pervert Justice -“Therefore, listen to me like intelligent men.Far be it from God to do evil;far be it from the Almighty to be unjust.

11.verse: He requites everyone according to his deeds,ensuring that he will receive what his conduct deserves.

12.verse: There can be no doubt that God will never do wrong;the Almighty will not pervert justice.

13.verse: “Did someone else entrust the world to his keeping?Who but he established the whole world?

14.verse: If he were to take back his Spirit to himselfand withdraw back into himself his breath,

15.verse: all flesh would perish instantaneouslyand mankind would turn again to dust.

16.verse: “If you have any semblance of intelligence, O Job,pay attention to what I am saying.

17.verse: How could an enemy of justice ever govern?Would you dare to condemn the Righteous One, the Almighty,

18.verse: who says to a king, ‘You are a scoundrel,’and to nobles, ‘You are wicked men’?

19.verse: “He shows no special respect to princes,nor does he make any distinction between rich and poor,for they are all the work of his hands.

20.verse: They die suddenly, without warning,in the middle of the night;at his touch the rich are no more,and he removes the mighty without lifting a finger.

21.verse: God’s Eyes Observe the Ways of Humans -“For his eyes observe the ways of humans,and he watches every step they take.

22.verse: Nowhere is there darkness or gloom so densewhere evildoers may conceal themselves.

23.verse: He forewarns no one when his time will cometo appear before God for judgment.

24.verse: Without holding a trial he shatters the mightyand establishes others in their place.

25.verse: Knowing the sinful deeds they do,he overthrows them at night and they are crushed.

26.verse: “He strikes them down for their crimeswhile others look on,

27.verse: because they have turned away from following himand paid no heed to any of his ways.

28.verse: But they caused the cries of the poor to reach him,so that he heard the anguished appeal of the afflicted.

29.verse: “But if he remains silent and no one can condemn him,and if he hides his face so that no one can behold him,it is because he rules over nations and individuals

30.verse: to prevent a godless man from rulingand to set some wrongdoer free from affliction.

31.verse: Job Is a Rebel to God -“Suppose someone were to say to God,‘I was wrong, but I will not offend anymore;

32.verse: instruct me how to avoid sinso that I will not do it again.’

33.verse: In your opinion, should God then punish such a personbecause he rejected his laws?For it is up to you to decide, not me;therefore, please enlighten us.

34.verse: “Men of intelligence will say to me,and any wise listener will assert:

35.verse: ‘Job speaks without knowledge;what he says lacks any intelligence.’

36.verse: Would that Job be tried to the limit,since his answers are those of the wicked.

37.verse: For he is adding rebellion to his sinby making an end of justice among usand insulting God with abusive words.”

1.verse: Elihu’s Third Speech -Chapter 35 -How Does Human Conduct Affect God? -Then Elihu continued his speech, saying:

2.verse: “Do you think that you can defend your uprightnessby claiming that you are just before God?

3.verse: For you said: ‘What does it mean to you?Or what would you gain if I sinned?’

4.verse: I will provide an answer for youand your three friends as well.

5.verse: “Look up to the skies and see;observe the clouds towering above you.

6.verse: If you sin, how can that affect God?And if your offenses are multiplied, how do you hurt him?

7.verse: If you are righteous, what do you give him?What does he receive from your hand?

8.verse: Your wickedness affects only someone like you,and your righteousness affects only your fellow men.

9.verse: No One Asks, “Where Is God?” -“People cry out under the weight of oppression;they cry for help against the power of the mighty.

10.verse: But not one of them asks, ‘Where is God, my Maker,who protects me during the night,

11.verse: who gave us greater intelligence than the animals of the earthand made us wiser than the birds of the air?’

12.verse: Although they cry out, God does not answerbecause of the pride of the wicked.

13.verse: “But it is foolish to say that God does not hearor that the Almighty does not pay attention.

14.verse: Even though you do not see him,he is aware of your plight,and you must wait for his decision.

1.verse: Elihu’s Fourth Speech -Chapter 36 -God Renders Justice to the Afflicted. -Elihu then proceeded further and said:

2.verse: “Be patient a little longer while I instruct you,for I have more to say on God’s behalf.

3.verse: I will take my knowledge from afarto support my assertion that my Master is just.

4.verse: I promise that there will be no flaws in my arguments;I come before you as a man of sound learning.

5.verse: “God is mighty and does not recant;he is great because of firmness of heart.

6.verse: He does not let the wicked live on in all vigorand renders justice to the afflicted.

7.verse: He does not withdraw his eyes from the righteous,but he seats them forever with kings on the throne,and they are exalted forever.

8.verse: “He will also have sinners fettered with chainsand held fast by the bonds of affliction

9.verse: after having denounced their conductand the sins of pride that they have committed.

10.verse: He opens their ears to correction,commanding them to turn back from their evil ways.

11.verse: “If they obey and once again serve him,they will live out their days in prosperity,and their years will pass pleasantly.

12.verse: But if they do not obey him,they will cross the river of deathand die as a result of their stubbornness.

13.verse: Those whose hearts turn away from God rage against him,and they do not cry for help when he chains them.

14.verse: They die in the bloom of their youthafter a dissolute life.

15.verse: But God rescues the suffering from their affliction,employing their distress to instruct them.

16.verse: “He also seeks to snatch you from torment.When you were enjoying a life of comfortwith abundant riches and plenteous food,

17.verse: you refused to bring the wicked to trialor to uphold the rights of the orphan.

18.verse: Beware lest abundance cloud your judgmentand that you not be corrupted by lavish gifts.

19.verse: Bring the powerful to justice, not merely the poor,those who are powerful, not only the weak.

20.verse: “Do not long for the nightwhen you can drag people away from their homes.

21.verse: Take care not to turn to evil;that is why you are now being tested by affliction.

22.verse: God Is Truly Great -“Behold, God is exalted in his power.What teacher can equal him?

23.verse: Who has prescribed the course he should follow?Who can dare to say to him, ‘You have done wrong’?

24.verse: “Therefore, remember to extol his workwhich men have always praised in song.

25.verse: All men can behold it,admiring it from afar.

26.verse: God is so great that he is beyond our understanding;the number of his years is past counting.

27.verse: “It is God who draws up drops of waterthat he distills as rain to the streams.

28.verse: His rain clouds pour downand provide abundant water for mankind.

29.verse: “Can anyone fathom how he spreads the cloudsas the carpeting of his tent?

30.verse: Behold how he scatters his lightningand covers the depths of the sea.

31.verse: This is how he nourishes the nations,providing food for them in abundance.

32.verse: He holds the lightning in his handsand commands it to strike the designated mark.

33.verse: His thunder warns us of his comingas he prepares for combat against iniquity.

1.verse: Chapter 37 -“This also causes my heart to trembleand to leap out of its place.

2.verse: Listen to the thunder of God’s voiceand the rumbling that comes forth from his mouth.

3.verse: He sends it forth across the heavens,along with his lightning to the ends of the earth.

4.verse: Following this, there comes a roaring sound,as God thunders with his majestic voice,and he does not restrain his flashes of lightningwhen his voice is heard.

5.verse: “At God’s command marvels come to pass;he performs wonders beyond our ability to comprehend.

6.verse: For he says to the snow, ‘Fall upon the earth,’and to the rain shower, ‘Turn into a heavy downpour.’

7.verse: All human activity comes to a standstillso that everyone may acknowledge his power.

8.verse: Wild beasts return to their lairsand take shelter in their dens.

9.verse: “The tempest comes out of its chamber,and the north winds bring bitter cold.

10.verse: By the breath of God ice is formedand the surface of the waters becomes frozen.

11.verse: He weighs down the thick clouds with moisture,and they scatter his lightning.

12.verse: Following his command they blow aboutover the face of the entire earthto do whatever he directs.

13.verse: Whether for correction of his people or for love,he causes all this to happen.

14.verse: Reflect Upon the Marvelous Works of God -“Listen to my words, O Job;stop and reflect upon the marvelous works of God.

15.verse: Do you know how God controls the clouds,or how he makes his lightning flash?

16.verse: Do you know how the clouds are balanced,the wondrous work of the one who is perfect in knowledge?

17.verse: You who swelter in your stifling garmentswhen the earth lies still under the south wind,

18.verse: can you, like him, spread out the skies,hard as a mirror of cast metal?

19.verse: “Teach us, then, what we should say to him;because of ignorance, we cannot present our case.

20.verse: Do my words have any effect on him?Is he informed of any man’s commands?

21.verse: Sometimes the light vanishes,and the sky is overcast with clouds;then the wind comes and sweeps them away.

22.verse: “Out of the north golden splendor comes forth,and God is surrounded by awesome majesty.

23.verse: But the Almighty we cannot find;he is unequaled in power and judgment,and in his righteousness he will not violate justice.

24.verse: Therefore, men revere him,and all thoughtful men fear him.”

1.verse: The Intervention of God -The Lord’s First Speech -Chapter 38 -Gird Up Your Loins. -Then from the heart of the storm the Lord answered Job:

2.verse: “Who is this who obscures my intentionswith words devoid of knowledge?

3.verse: Gird up your loins now like a man.I will ask you questions,and you will give me the answers.

4.verse: A1: The Mysteries of the Cosmos -Where Were You When I Laid the Earth’s Foundations? -“Where were you when I laid the earth’s foundations?Tell me, if you have understanding.

5.verse: Who determined its measurements? Do you know?Who stretched out the measuring line over it?

6.verse: What supports the pillars at its bases?Who laid its cornerstone

7.verse: while the morning stars sang in unisonand the sons of God shouted for joy?

8.verse: “Who shut up the sea behind doorswhen it burst forth from the womb,

9.verse: when I made the clouds its garmentand wrapped it in thick darkness,

10.verse: when I established bounds for itand set its barred doors in place,

11.verse: when I said, ‘This far may you come, but no farther;here is where your proud waves must halt’?

12.verse: Have You Ever Commanded the Morning? -“During your entire life have you ever commanded the morning to appearor caused the dawn to rise in the east

13.verse: so that it might grasp the ends of the earthand shake the wicked from its surface?

14.verse: She turns it like clay under a sealand dyes it as though it were a garment.

15.verse: But light is withheld from the wicked,and their raised arm is broken.

16.verse: Have You Ever Walked at the Bottom of the Abyss? -“Have you ever descended to the depths of the seaand walked at the bottom of the abyss?

17.verse: Have the gates of death been revealed to youor have you seen the gates of the shadow of death?

18.verse: Have you comprehended the vast expanse of the earth?Tell me if you know all this.

19.verse: “Can you point out the way to the dwelling of lightand show the abode of darkness,

20.verse: so that you may assign each to its designated boundaryand escort them on their homeward paths?

21.verse: Surely you must know this,for you had already been bornand the years of your life are beyond numbering!

22.verse: Have You Entered the Place Where the Snow Is Stored? -“Have you entered the place where the snow is stored,or seen the storehouses of the hail,

23.verse: which I have reserved for times of distress,for the times of war and battle?

24.verse: Can you show me the place where lightning is dispersedor where the east wind is scattered over the earth?

25.verse: “Who has cut a channel for the downpour of rainand cleared a path for the thunderstorm

26.verse: so that rain may fall on uninhabited lands,on the wilderness devoid of human life,

27.verse: and thus reinvigorate the wastes and the desolate land,enabling grass to sprout on the thirsty ground?

28.verse: “Does the rain have a father?Who has begotten the drops of dew?

29.verse: Whose womb brings forth the ice?Who gives birth to the frost of heaven,

30.verse: causing a layer of stone to cover the watersand the surface of the earth to congeal?

31.verse: Do You Know the Ordinances of the Heavens? -“Can you bind the chains of the Pleiadesor loosen the bonds of Orion?

32.verse: Can you bring forth the constellations in their seasonor indicate which way to go to the Bear and its cubs?

33.verse: Do you know the ordinances of the heavens?Can you put into effect their rule on the earth?

34.verse: “Can you raise up your voice to command the cloudsto envelop you in a deluge of rain?

35.verse: Will flashes of lightning come forth at your commandand say to you, ‘Here we are’?

36.verse: Who has endowed the heart with wisdomand given understanding to the mind?

37.verse: Who can number all the rain cloudsand empty the cisterns of the heavens

38.verse: so that the dust solidifies into a thick massand the clods of earth cling together?

39.verse: A2: The Astonishing World of the Animals -The Lion and the Raven -“Can you hunt prey for the lionessor satisfy the hunger of young lions

40.verse: while they crouch in their densor lie in wait in the bushes?

41.verse: Who provides the raven with preywhen its little ones cry out to Godin their need for sustenance?

1.verse: Chapter 39 -The Mountain Goat and the Deer -“Do you know when the mountain goats give birth?Have you ever observed deer in labor?

2.verse: Can you accurately number the months that they carry their youngor know the time of their delivery

3.verse: when they crouch down to give birthand deliver their offspring?

4.verse: Once their fawns grow strong and become independent,they go forth on their own and do not return.

5.verse: The Wild Donkey and the Wild Ox -“Who has given the wild donkey its freedom?Who has untied its ropes?

6.verse: I gave it the wastelands as its homeand the salt flats for its dwelling.

7.verse: It scorns the noise of the city;it is not forced to obey a driver’s shouted order.

8.verse: The mountains are the pasture over which it rangesin search of any green foliage.

9.verse: “Is the wild ox willing to serve you?Will it stay by your manger during the night?

10.verse: Can you use ropes to harness its strength?Will it harrow the furrows after you?

11.verse: Can you depend upon its massive strengthto do your heavy work?

12.verse: Can you rely upon it to return homeand bring your grain to your threshing floor?

13.verse: The Ostrich and the Horse -“The wings of an ostrich are ineffectual,since its pinions and its plumage are scanty.

14.verse: It leaves its eggs on the groundand depends on the earth to warm them,

15.verse: forgetting that a foot may crush themor that a wild animal may trample upon them.

16.verse: It cruelly disowns its youngas if they were not its own,unconcerned if its labor has been wasted.

17.verse: For God has denied it wisdomand deprived it of understanding.

18.verse: Yet with its swiftness of footit leaves both horse and rider in the dust.

19.verse: “Do you give the horse its strength?Have you clothed its neck with a mane?

20.verse: Do you make it leap like a locust,striking terror with its proud snorting?

21.verse: It paws the plain jubilantly and prancesas it charges the battle line with all its strength.

22.verse: It laughs at fear and is frightened of nothing;it does not shy away when confronted with the sword.

23.verse: “The quiver rattles at its side;the spear and the javelin flash.

24.verse: Trembling with eagerness it eats up the ground,and when the trumpet sounds, there is no holding it back.

25.verse: At each blast of the trumpet it cries ‘Aha!’From afar it scents the battle,the shouts of the commanders, and the war cries.

26.verse: The Hawk and the Eagle -“Did your wisdom enable the hawk to soaras it spreads its wings toward the south?

27.verse: Does the eagle soar aloft at your commandto build its nest on the lofty heights?

28.verse: It dwells on the cliff in security,spending its nights on a rocky crag.

29.verse: From there it watches for its prey;its eyes are able to behold it from afar.

30.verse: Its young ones hungrily drink the blood;wherever the slain are, it is there.”

1.verse: Chapter 40 -Job’s Response to the Lord -The Lord then said to Job:

2.verse: “Will the one who finds fault with the Almighty respond?Anyone who argues with God should state his case.”

3.verse: Job then answered the Lord and said:

4.verse: “Since I am of little importance, how can I reply to you?I will simply place my hand over my mouth.

5.verse: Although I have spoken once, I will not answer;I have spoken twice, but I will do so no more.”

6.verse: The Lord’s Second Speech -Unleash the Fury of Your Wrath. -Then the Lord addressed Job out of the whirlwind:

7.verse: “Gird up your loins like a man.I intend to put questions to you,and you must give me your answers.

8.verse: Will you continue to deny that I am just?Will you condemn me in order to justify yourself?

9.verse: Do you have an arm like that of God?Can your voice thunder as loudly as his?

10.verse: “Display your majesty and grandeur;array yourself with glory and splendor.

11.verse: Unleash the fury of your wrathand humble the haughty with a glance.

12.verse: Look on all who are proud and shatter them;strike down the wicked where they stand.

13.verse: Bury all of them in the earth together,and shroud their faces in an unknown grave.

14.verse: Then I in turn will acknowledge to youthat your own right hand is strong enough to save you.

15.verse: Behemoth . . . the First of God’s Works -“Look at Behemoth whom I made just as I made you;it feeds on grass like an ox.

16.verse: Yet what strength it has in its loinsand what power in the muscles of its body.

17.verse: Its tail is as stiff as a cedar;the sinews of its thighs are tightly knit.

18.verse: Its bones are like tubes of bronze,its limbs like rods of iron.

19.verse: “It is the first of God’s works;only its Maker can control it with the sword.

20.verse: The mountains provide it with food,as do the wild animals that roam the hills.

21.verse: It rests under the lotus treesas it lies hidden among the reeds in the marsh.

22.verse: “The lotus trees afford it shade,and it is sheltered by the willows of the stream.

23.verse: Even if the river becomes turbulent,it does not become frightened;it remains tranquileven if the waters rise up to its mouth.

24.verse: Who can blind its eyes and capture itor pierce its nose with a trap?

1.verse: Chapter 41 -“Any hope you have in this regard would be futile;just the mere sight of it would convince you to retreat.

2.verse: How ferocious it is when aroused!No one could ever stand up to confront it.

3.verse: Who has attacked it and remained unscathed?There has never been anyone under the heavens.

4.verse: “Nor will I keep silence about its limbs,or its strength, or its magnificent frame.

5.verse: Who can strip off its outer garmentor pierce the reinforced armor of its breastplate?

10.verse: “When it sneezes, sprays of light flash forth,and its eyes are like the rays of the dawn.

11.verse: Fiery torches emerge from its mouthand sparks come flying out.

12.verse: Smoke issues forth from its nostrilsas from a boiling pot on the fire.

13.verse: Its breath sets coals ablaze,and flames pour forth from its mouth.

14.verse: “Strength resides in its neck,causing terror to all who behold it.

15.verse: The folds of its flesh are joined together,firmly set in place and immovable.

1.verse: Chapter 42 -Job’s Final Response -Now I Have Seen You with My Own Eyes. -Job then answered the Lord in these words:

2.verse: “I know that you can do all thingsand that no plan you conceive can be thwarted.

3.verse: Because of my ignoranceI have spoken of things that I have not understood,of things too wondrous for me to know.

4.verse: “You had said, ‘Listen and let me speak.I intend to put questions to you,and you must give me your answers.’

5.verse: I had heard of you only by hearsay,but now that I have seen you with my own eyes,

6.verse: I retract what I have said,repenting in dust and ashes.”

7.verse: Epilogue: Job’s Honor and Goods Are Restored -You Have Not Spoken About Me As You Should Have Done. -After the Lord had finished speaking to Job, he said to Eliphaz the Temanite: “My anger is aroused against you and your two friends, for you have not spoken about me as you should, as my servant Job has.

8.verse: Therefore, now take seven bulls and seven rams, and go to my servant Job, and offer up for yourselves a burnt offering. Then my servant Job will pray for you, and I will accept his prayer not to punish you severely, for you have not spoken about me as you should, as my servant Job has.”

9.verse: Therefore, Eliphaz the Temanite and Bildad the Shuhite and Zophar the Naamathite went forth and did what the Lord had commanded them. And the Lord accepted the intercession of Job.

10.verse: God Restores the Prosperity of Job. -Thereupon the Lord restored the prosperity of Job after he had prayed for his friends, and he enriched him with twice as much as he had possessed before.

11.verse: Then all his brothers and sisters came to him, as well as all his friends from former days. As they feasted with him in his house, they sympathized with him about his previous troubles, and they comforted him for all the misfortunes that the Lord had permitted to be inflicted upon him. Moreover, each of them gave him some money and a gold ring.

12.verse: The Lord blessed the end of Job’s life more than the beginning. He had fourteen thousand sheep, six thousand camels, a thousand yoke of oxen, and a thousand donkeys.

13.verse: He also fathered seven sons and three daughters.

14.verse: He named the eldest daughter Jemimah, the second Keziah, and the third Keren-happuch.

15.verse: In the entire land there were no women as beautiful as Job’s daughters, and their father gave them an inheritance along with their brothers.

16.verse: After this, Job lived for another one hundred and forty years, and he saw his children and his children’s children to the fourth generation.

17.verse: Then Job died at a very great age.
